required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Kiosk-Model Self-Triage System in the Pediatric Emergency Department
clinical_study.official_title: Assessing Utility of a "Kiosk Model" Self-Triage System in the Pediatric Emergency Department of A Tertiary Care Teaching Hospital

collaborator.agency: Agency for Healthcare Research and Quality (AHRQ)

brief_summary.textblock: An audio-assisted self-triage kiosk in the Pediatric Emergency Department (ED) is expected to significantly reduce triage times, without any sacrifice of the quality of information that would be obtained by nurse-initiated triage.

detailed_description.textblock: With the rapid evolution of consumer based information technology patients have the opportunity to become collaborative partners in their care. In addition, by bridging information gaps and improving workflow efficiency, continuity of care is optimized and the potential risk for error is reduced. Triage time for kiosk self-triage and nurse-initiated triage will be compared in terms of 1) triage time; 2) accuracy of medical history obtained; and 3) patient satisfaction.

primary_outcome.time_frame: From beginning of triage to completion of triage.
primary_outcome.description: The time it takes for the patient to be triaged, compared across the kiosk and nurse-initiated triage conditions.

secondary_outcome.description: To check for accuracy of medical history information, two RAs approached enrolled parents during the course of their ED visit in the individual patient examination rooms. The RAs conducted a brief face-to-face interview with parents and verified information from the nursing triage summary sheet (for non-kiosk users) and the printout of history sheet from the kiosk users, noting any discrepancies on a Discrepancy Rating Scale. All historical discrepancies were categorized into three groups: major discrepancy, minor discrepancy and no discrepancy.

Custom survey with 4 items capturing satisfaction with Understanding, Ease of Answering Questions, Respect for Privacy, and Overall Feelings. For each item, the lowest possible score was 1 and the highest possible score was 6. For Understanding, the lowest actual score was 2 and the highest actual score was 6. For Ease of Answering Questions, the lowest actual score was 2 and the highest actual score was 6. For Respect for Privacy the lowest actual score was 3 and the highest actual score was 6. For Overall Feelings, the lowest actual score was 3 and the highest actual score was 6. For the (unweighted) average of all 4 items, the lowest possible score was 1 and the highest possible score was 6. The lowest actual score was 3.5 and the highest actual score was 6.0.

arm_group.description: Audio-assisted self-triage kiosk for obtaining medical history and presenting problem(s)
Nurse-initiated triage for obtaining medical history and presenting problem(s)

intervention.description: Nurse-assisted triage for obtaining medical history and presenting problem(s)
Audio-assisted self-triage kiosk for obtaining medical history and presenting problem(s)

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Between 0 and 18 years of age
- Registered in the Pediatric ED
- Accompanied by parent/guardian 18 years or older
- Version 3 Emergency Severity Index (ESI) of 3 to 5
- Parent or guardian able to communicate in English or Spanish
Exclusion Criteria:
- Deemed medically unstable
- ESI score of 1 or 2
- Incarcerated or in juvenile detention
- Parent/guardian unable to communicate in English or Spanish

reference.citation: Morrison-Beedy D, Carey MP, Tu X. Accuracy of audio computer-assisted self-interviewing (ACASI) and self-administered questionnaires for the assessment of sexual behavior. AIDS Behav. 2006 Sep;10(5):541-52.

participant_flow.recruitment_details: Patients were recruited from the Pediatric Emergency Department at Maricopa Integrated Health System between February 2012 and April 2012.

certain_agreements.pi_employee: Principal Investigators are NOT employed by the organization sponsoring the study.
certain_agreements.restrictive_agreement: There is NOT an agreement between Principal Investigators and the Sponsor (or its agents) that restricts the PI's rights to discuss or publish trial results after the trial is completed.
